Description: The Virgin suckling the infant Christ; the Virgin feeds the naked child who holds the globe in his right hand, to the left are St Antony and John, to the right St Lucy and Catherine, in upper corners two roundels with the Annunciation, Gabriel on the left and the Virgin on the right, in lower left corner a pig with a monogram TM Woodcut, modern impression
Curator's comments: One of the rare early Italian woodcuts. Schreiber notes that the figures standing at the side seem to belong to a later period than the Virgin and Child. The print is a modern impression from the block, which is still extant in the collection at Modena. For further information and bibliography see the entry by Laura Aldovini on the online catalogue 'Atlante delle xilografie italiane del Rinascimento', ALU0044.1.
Bibliographic references: Schreiber 1926-1930 / Handbuch der Holz- und Metalschnitte des XV Jahrhunderts (1045)
Atlante delle xilografie italiane del Rinascimento (ALU0044.1)
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Evangelist
Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Representation of: St Catherine of Alexandria
